intro: Aregelia cyanea var. simplex, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is native to the eastern United States and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. Its flowers are typically borne on tall, erect stems and are composed of three petals and three sepals. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to naturalize in suitable habitats.
